data.title: Modesto culture
data.text: Modesto long lacked a real venue, this place more than filled that void. The Gallo Center is gorgeous. There are no bad seats. We have attended several events since its opening and can't wait for the next one!

data.title: Shows
data.text: Have seen many great shows , all the seats are good , no matter where you sit . the sound system was top notch !

data.title: Variety of fun every week
data.text:
I love the Gallo Center for the Arts !! I go to ballet, opera, plays, musicals and more. It is a wonderful place to see all sorts of productions.  I take my grandson (age 5 1/2 ) to children's shows and i always enjoy them also.
I always see friends there..... sometimes we go to dinner first and make a night of it.

data.title: Jethro Tull Rock Opera
data.text: Amazing first half.  The highlight was aqualung. Into the wood was also very good as was  HeavyHorses Farm on the Freeway  and Prosperous Pasture interesting use of embedded video technology.  Great venue.

data.title: Wonderful place to see plays or hear music
data.text: I have been to the Gallo now about a dozen times. We have seen great plays there. My favorite was Memphis. It was back in the 40's when black people could not enter a white neighborhood. It is a must see for every generation. Not only for the History but to understand the racist element that was back in the time. Very educational.

data.title: The Gem of the Central Valley
data.text: 1st time I went to the Gallo was to see Huey Lewis and the News back in 2014 I believe. I have since been back to see Rock Concerts, Joan Jett, The Monkees, Comedy Steven Wright and Blues to name a few. Sound is great and I don't think there is a bad seat in the house.

data.title: great local arts venue
data.text: Top notch entertainment locally without having to make the trek to the Bay Area. The shows are wonderful with first rate acts. Central West Ballet is spectacular and always very professional. A must see!

data.title: Great venue for all types of entertainment
data.text: I haven't been to the Bay Area in a few years- Gallo Center for the Arts brings in the entertainment I want to see, and it's minutes from my house! There isn't a bad seat in the house and the acoustics are great!

data.title: Always Entertaining!
data.text: I and my family always enjoy a night at Gallo Center: luxurious setting, great views, good entertainment. The only criticism I might have is that the ushers can be stuffy and a bit uptight and overly controlling at times. They take their jobs too seriously and give people a hard time about very minor issues. Otherwise, I would highly recommend Gallo for your entertainment pleasure!

data.title: We have had so many great experiences!
data.text: Have not had a bad experience yet! Parking all around/some metered. Seating is almost 100% great. Has an early arrival Bar/Café and intermission bar/cafe'  also. Love this venue!

data.title: Ned Byrne & Ryan Kelly - Acoustically Irish
data.text:
It was our first visit to a program at the Gallo Center for the Arts.  We found that these two performers were very good and I would recommend to go see them if they are in your area,  The only thing that keeps me from rating this very good was not the performers, but the visitors in the area right in front of the stage.  These women consistently kept snapping photos, and shooting video of the performers even thought that was against the rules. The constant flashing back light on their Smart Phones were a distraction to those of us that were in the balcony area or even floor level behind them.  We registered a complaint with the Gallo Center Management about this, but they said they are trying to keep patrons for doing these types of acts.
I suggested that they ask for all cell phones from all of the attendees and their answer was that might not be possible do to the need to have available contact from, family, friends or doctors might cause them a law suit. I pointed out if they placed one of their people up in the balcony they could see who was in violation and then call one of the others to come a escort the violator out of the facility there by solving every ones problem.    
I do recommend going to the Gallo Center when ever there is an event scheduled that you are interested in going to see, however you might want to ask any representative of the Gallo Center if they have taken care of the people taking pictures and videos of the performers.  This would let them know you have been warned about the abusers and the misuse of their cell phones. I believe that we attended in September the first week of 2015.

data.title: Brian Regan Comedy show
data.text: Had a great laugh throughout the show. Loved it.  I would highly recommend anyone to watch Brian Regan if you want to laugh your pants off.

data.title: Gallo center
data.text: Great place parking easy only about 5bad seats in the whole place . Beautiful place to go  dress up or down  feel great both ways.  Have seen musical, comedian, singers,  everything great.

data.title: Music & arts
data.text: The Gallo center has done an outstanding job in bringing artist from around the world to our little corner of the world.  I usually had to go to the Bay Area or Vegas for music concerts, but now can do that here.  Love it. The Gloria trevi concert back in October was fantastic.  Will go again!

data.title: Love the shows
data.text: We have gone to many of the musical shows and enjoyed every one!  Our first experience at the Gallo theater was to see My Fair Lady, one of my favorites. The scenery and players were some of the best I have seen.  We also went to Il Volo and the Celtic Thunder, amazing!, We look forward to our next event, such quality entertainment.

data.title: Take in a show.
data.text: Have seen concerts and comedy shows and have enjoyed them all,  Not a bad seat and they are all close to the stage.They offer all kinds of entertainment, so check their schedule and you should find a show you will like..

data.title: Truly the Gem of Modesto
data.text: The Gallo Center is a state-of-the -art performance venue. It consists of two theaters--one for large like concerts and Broadway plays, the other for more intimate performances. The sound system is excellent, the venue is well-maintained and it serves attractions that are appropriate for the entire community. What a great addition to the city!

data.title: Local, comfy seats, serve alcohol
data.text: Have been here for a Cardiovascular Symposium for work as well as for comedian Rodney Carrington. Beautiful building, four floors with bar/drinks counter on every floor. If you want to take alcohol inside, you have to buy the plastic cup with twist close lid. Seats are comfy and hostesses are very welcoming.  Look forward to going again to see more shows. Just wish they offered a bit more selection on shows.

data.title: San Francisco quality
data.text: Have been there on several occasions for Modesto Symphony and other special events. The entire experience was excellent! We have sat in the very back of the auditorium upstairs and the acoustics are absolutely amazing. The volunteers help you to your seat and the ambience is big city quality.

data.title: Gallo Center for the arts - Here's where we get to see all the best!!
data.text:
I have watched the events offered at Gallo center for the Arts get better and better every year.  Never was what they offered inferior, but with time, we have gained so much more!  From Lightwire Theater, to Les Miz, to Steve Martin, to Jay Leno... amazing performances abound and I have never been less than thrilled with every event I attend.  If you have not been there, you are missing so very much!

Seeing Yes Company preform Les Miserable was one of the best things I have experienced this year.  My two granddaughters were mesmerized by the story and the fantastic talent.    Gallo provides a luxury venue that gives this to us.   Thank you, Gallo!!!
